meanings.definition: To peek or look quickly and furtively.
meanings.sent1: She was keeking through the keyhole to see who was outside.
meanings.sent2: I caught him keeking at my test paper during the exam.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was keeking at the birds in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The detective was keeking around the corner to catch a glimpse of the suspect.
meanings.sent5: He was keeking over his shoulder to make sure he wasn't being followed.

meanings.sent1: She gave a quick keeking at the mysterious figure in the shadows.
meanings.sent2: He took a keeking at the map to find the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent3: The child's keeking revealed his excitement about the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The thief's keeking around the corner gave away his presence.
meanings.sent5: The audience's keeking at the magician's trick made him smile.
